p:
T represents the hourly incubation temperature, b 1 is the maximal developmental rate, b 3 is the temperature at which b 1 occurs, b 2 is the temperature at which developmental rate is b 1/10, b 4 controls how sharply d s/d t approaches 0 at the lower temperatures, and b 5 controls the asymmetry of d s/d t
50 . The best fit was given by b
1 = 2.2, b 2 = 18 °C, b 3 = 32.5 °C, b 4 = 14, and b 5 = 0.6 (Fig. 3a), which correctly estimated the developmental zero around 14 °C as previously reported for C. picta
51 . A logistic regression of sex ratio by wCTUs was then calculated using the function glm in R version 3.5.1
52 .
